p: The frequency of cannibalistic attacks varied from 0.03 in Telm 3 to 0.07 in Telm 7 ( table 1; figure 1 e). Contrary to our prediction, the frequency of cannibalistic attacks was 0.05 BC in Telms 1–5 compared with 0.07 AC in Telm 7 ( figure 1 e), although the difference was not statistically significant ( χ 2 = 0.188, df = 1, p = 0.171). Incomplete drillholes ( figure 1 b) accounted for 17.1% ( n = 20) of the total number of drillholes, with failed attacks being more common AC, though not significant statistically ( χ 2 = 2.68, df = 1, p = 0.102; table 1). The mean body size of all drilled and undrilled naticids was 18.0 mm ± 0.20 s.e. and 17.1 mm ± 0.42 s.e. before and after the cooling event, respectively, suggesting no significant change ( t = 1.71, df = 2,071, p = 0.09; figure 1 f).
